column15: What is your annual household income?
column16: What was your overall impression of this event (quality, lighting, sound, value)?
column17: Please share any other suggestions or ideas that would help us enhance your experience at Gesa Power House Theatre. If you would like someone to respond to your feedback, please include your contact information. Thank you!

column16: Incredible! I loved everything about it and I would love to experience more performances like the Caravan of Glam in Walla Walla. It was great to be able to have such wonderful performers here.
column17: My only note is that it was fairly loud, possibly offering complimentary earplugs (or even ones for sale for $1) could be really helpful, especially for kids and neurodivergent folx. I brought my own earplugs, and I had a great time.

column16: Had the very best time! All of the ladies were absolutely amazing! Can't wait til they come back .
So fun! Lighting and sound were well done, high quality performances
Such a fun evening! Very entertaining, great seats,staff was helpful and it was fun to be able to meet the “stars” after the show. Looking forward to a repeat performance!

column17: Please bring them back again! It was a wonderful show and I loved the energy!  This was my second time seeing them at this venue

column16: It was amazing, but the music was a bit too loud, even for the enthusiastic nature of the event.

It was absolutely amazing. Thank you for the most amazing experience. The performance was so high energy and fabulous. The dance party was a great idea. Thank you having security and also keeping chalk guy at bay. They’re so much to worry about these days and this wa an island in the storm. Thank you!
column17: I recently read that Europe has been giving “arts passes” to young people after the pandemic. They can use the money to go to live performances, museums, etc. I had a thought … it would be really nice to find a way to bring both young people and adults who typically can’t afford live performances into the Power House. One way would be applying for AAUW and other grants. Then finding ways to find the communities that need to come. Clearly, you have done excellent work getting the Triple Point youth in. Would be cool to let more Latino/a people in. Just a thought. Greatly appreciate all you do!

column16: Just Perfect!!  We enjoy the variety of entertainment you provide and like to come often. Walla Walla is very lucky we have hard working, open minded, staff and volunteers. Thank you!!!
